cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest-to-north-northwest and forecast to accelerate toward the central Texas coast, then slow/stall inland while drifting generally northward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O’Connor–Rockport area (between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch (also Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island (TS Watch); Port Mansfield to High Island (Storm-Surge Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and portions of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible at the port by Friday evening; brief gusts could exceed 60 mph if the core tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast surge 4–6 ft above ground level possible along the Upper Texas Coast, including Galveston Bay and Texas City terminals.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 in with isolated 20 in totals possible, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding in and around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged operational disruptions from flooding, power outages, and debris.
